programme.title: KASHF: THE LIFTING OF THE VEIL
programme.desc: A Pakistani man searches for the origins of his family curse.

programme.title: Millionaire Maker
programme.sub-title: Millionaire Maker - Fight or Flight
programme.desc: Shawn Meaike's Millionaire Maker is a new series that shows you what you're really worth. Shawn is confident he could pluck anyone - no matter their background or experience - and turn them into a 7-figure earner...IF, they have the right attitude and drive. This series is about Shawn selecting who he will mentor and teach to reach a level of success they never thought possible. Welcome to the toughest job interview of your life. In this episode, Shawn meets the contestants and immediately finds out who's actually willing to fight for the life they want.

programme.title: Millionaire Maker
programme.sub-title: Millionaire Maker - Uncomfortable Positions
programme.desc: Shawn only wants folks who are willing to be honest about their struggles because it shows you can be fearless. Everyone deserves a happy life...but he can only help you if you're ready to take a chance on yourself. In this episode, the candidates have to sell themselves. They have to tell Shawn their story because he wants to know how you got stuck...but more importantly, they have to convince him they won’t give up...no matter how hard it is to hang on, or take a leap of faith.

programme.title: World’s Greatest Motivators
programme.sub-title: World's Greatest Motivators - Jack Canfield
programme.desc: Jack Canfield, with cameo appearance by David Meltzer, interviewer.

programme.title: World’s Greatest Motivators
programme.sub-title: World's Greatest Motivators - Blaine Bartlett
programme.desc: Blaine Bartlett, with cameo appearances by David Meltzer, Cynthia Kersey, John Assaraf and emcee, Paisley Demby.

programme.title: Millionaire Maker
programme.sub-title: Millionaire Maker - Punch Me In The Face
programme.desc: If you had a chance to close Shawn, could you get it done? Today's the day we see who has the goods. Each team has one goal. Get the contract signed. Shawn is not going to make it easy, but often your audience isn't the hardest part. Sometimes getting out of your own way is the biggest challenge. Prepare to witness a pitch fest for the ages. You'll see that it doesn't matter what you're selling - a Yacht, a Ferrari, a Private Jet...or a Potato - if you don't connect with Shawn, you have no chance.

programme.title: Millionaire Maker
programme.sub-title: Millionaire Maker - No Time For Cold Feet
programme.desc: This is it. A winner will be chosen. The decision is FINAL...But we still have a crowd of candidates that each think they will be the one. Now comes a test of mental toughness. It's all come down to these final moments. Who can convince Shawn that they won't give up when things get...painful. What would you endure for a chance at greatness?...Watch the season finale of Shawn Meaike's Millionaire Maker.

programme.title: The Inspiration Show
programme.sub-title: Mantras Made Easy With Sherianna Boyle
programme.desc: Sherianna shares how to effectively use mantras and how they can positively influence your thinking and raise your vibration to match your desires.

programme.title: The Inspiration Show
programme.sub-title: Project Forgive - Dr. Shawne Duperon
programme.desc: Dr. Shawne Duperon shares how Project Forgive, has helped millions of people release pain, grudges and regret - and how you can too.

programme.sub-title: World's Greatest Motivators - Jack Canfield
programme.desc: Jack Canfield, with cameo appearance by David Meltzer, interviewer.

programme.title: World’s Greatest Motivators

programme.desc: Blaine Bartlett, with cameo appearances by David Meltzer, Cynthia Kersey, John Assaraf and emcee, Paisley Demby.

programme.title: Sex Talk
programme.sub-title: Sex Talk - Keeping the Sexual Fires Burning
programme.desc: Want to keep the fires burning even when you’re too tired? Got questions about how long ED medications last? We break it down on Sex Talk with Dr. Lia.

programme.title: Sex Talk
programme.sub-title: Sex Talk - Hot Sex Even Without Orgasm
programme.desc: Keeping it sexy between the sheets is possible even without the big “O” and a man wonders if he can get intimate post-heart attack. All this and more on Sex Talk with Dr. Lia.

programme.sub-title: Smart Life S1E11
programme.desc: Different Types of Procedure for Back Pain with Dr. Jose Mena, Exercises at Home with Torre Washington

programme.sub-title: Smart Life S1E12
programme.desc: What is Occupational Therapy? with Vickie Zamora, Ask the Expert Segment with Dr. Jonathan Fialkow, Online Dating with Paula Levine, PHD

programme.desc: Flu Season-How to Stay Healthy with Dr. Yvonne Johnson, When to Go to the ER with Dr. Yvonne Johnson, Scoliosis in Teens with Dr. Stephen George of Nicklaus Children's Hospital

programme.title: Smart Life

programme.desc: Diabetes with Dr. Paul Jellinger, Identifying Eating Disorders with Melissa Spann

programme.title: Smart Life
programme.sub-title: Smart Life S1E15

programme.title: HealthDay
programme.sub-title: Medical Gaslighting: How to Avoid It
programme.desc: We speak with experts about how to protect yourself from medical gaslighting, and other things you should know before you visit a doctor or dentist.

programme.title: HealthDay
programme.sub-title: The Truth About Vitamins
programme.desc: Nutrition expert Dr. Thunder Jalili joins us to discuss why Americans spend more than $30 billion a year on dietary supplements, despite decades of research disputing their ability to improve health outcomes.

programme.title: HealthDay
programme.sub-title: Diabetes: The Path to a Cure
programme.desc: Dr. Robert Gabbay, chief scientific and medical officer of the American Diabetes Association, speaks with us about new preventative drugs and devices for diabetes patients, and how much progress has been made in the path towards a cure.

programme.title: HealthDay
programme.sub-title: Inside the Latest Health Technology
programme.desc: In our medical technology episode, we explore how patients can use mobile apps to monitor and treat chronic conditions, discuss the positive and negative effects of video games on children, and look at how robotic pets are being used to assist people with dementia.

programme.title: HealthDay
programme.sub-title: What You Need to Know about the 988 Hotline
programme.desc: In this episode, we are joined by members of the National Action Alliance for Suicide Prevention to talk about the 988 suicide and crisis lifeline, discussing how the lifeline works and what more needs to be done to ensure equitable support for everyone.

programme.title: HealthDay
programme.sub-title: Fighting Heart Disease
programme.desc: The president of the American College of Cardiology joins us to discuss how heart disease is the leading cause of death in American women, and how different factors and treatments can lower or worsen your risk of cardiovascular disease.

programme.title: HealthDay
programme.sub-title: Why Are Allergies Getting Worse Every Year?
programme.desc: Medical experts meet to discuss seasonal allergies and why each spring brings more intense allergy symptoms than the last.

programme.title: HealthDay
programme.sub-title: What's Next for the CDC?
programme.desc: We’re joined by the former chief of staff at the CDC to discuss what the agency learned during the COVID-19 pandemic and how it plans to move forward. We’ll also take a look at the long-term effects of COVID and how you can boost your vaccine’s effectiveness even further.

programme.title: HealthDay
programme.sub-title: Maternity Risks
programme.desc: We’re joined by the president and CEO of March of Dimes to discuss the risks that pregnant women — particularly women of color — still face in the United States.

programme.title: HealthDay
programme.sub-title: The Future of Mental Health Treatment
programme.desc: In this episode, we take a look at the mental health benefits of healthy eating and exercising and explore the future of depression treatment, while debunking popular myths about causes and cures for depression.

programme.title: OmStars- Yoga Is Series
programme.sub-title: Yoga Is - Day 30 Freedom Simple Bridge / Urdhva Dhanurasana
programme.desc: Day 30 of our challenge is built around Bridge Pose, a simple backbend.

programme.title: OmStars- Yoga Is Series
programme.sub-title: Yoga Is - Day 31 Home Padmasana/Seated Pose
programme.desc: We’ll use the seated pose Padmasana to explore what it means to be happy, peaceful and spiritually at home in your own skin.

programme.title: Good Morning Joy
programme.sub-title: Good Morning Joy - Speaking with the Heart
programme.desc: Dr. Heather Browne is a master at transforming conversations between couples. She shares how she helps couples bridge divides and cultivate more fulfilling relationships. Plus, we are back in India chatting with some cute kids and sharing good news.

programme.title: Good Morning Joy
programme.sub-title: Good Morning Joy - Unleash Your Inner Warrior
programme.desc: Hollywood star, Sean Kanan, helps you unleash your inner warrior and change your life with his new book. We head to Rochester, NY, for a party that has been 46 years in the making. And we go international with inspiring conversations from India and Italy!

programme.title: The Aware Show
programme.sub-title: The Aware Show: Cynthia James - Does Your Voice Matter?
programme.desc: Host Lisa Garr interviews Cynthia James. Known as a Champion of Change, she is a best-selling author, speaker, transformational coach, and spiritual leader. Today she discusses the importance of using your voice and how it takes great courage to step out and state your beliefs. She talks about what it means to be connected as one human family. Her latest book is, Does My Voice Matter? – A Journey of Self-Discovery, Authenticity, and Empowerment.

programme.title: The Aware Show
programme.sub-title: The Aware Show: Dr. Beth McDougall - Achieving Optimal Health
programme.desc: Host Lisa Garr interviews Dr Beth McDougall who has been transforming the practice of medicine by bringing innovative therapeutics to thousands of patients for more than two decades. Long known as a medical detective, she is contributing to an emerging medical paradigm in which medicine and physics intersect. She describes health in the context of our relationship to the Unified Field -- a continuous field of infinite energy and information from which all matter and life emerges.

programme.title: The Aware Show
programme.sub-title: The Aware Show: Dr. Bernard Beitman - Meaningful Coincidences
programme.desc: Host Lisa Garr interviews Dr. Bernard Beitman, often called the King of Coincidences. Dr Beitman is the first psychiatrist since Carl Jung to systematize the study of coincidences. A graduate of Yale Medical School, he did his psychiatric residency at Stanford University. His latest book is Meaningful Coincidences: How and Why Synchronicity and Serendipity Happen.

programme.title: The Aware Show
programme.sub-title: The Aware Show: Marc H Morgenstern - The Soul of the Deal
programme.desc: Host Lisa Garr interviews Marc H. Morgenstern who has taught Street Smart Startups at UC Berkeley. He's a veteran dealmaker and entrepreneur with billions of dollars of buying, selling, and financing innovative and disruptive businesses. He's a longtime board member of The Rex Foundation, the non-profit founded by the Grateful Dead. He talks about the similarities of attending a Dead show, and making a shrewd business deal. His latest book is The Soul of the Deal.

programme.title: The Secrets of the Keys
programme.desc: Elizabeth comes face-to-face with her spiritual guide, Gwen who has an intriguing opportunity for her.

programme.title: Get Your Yoga On
programme.sub-title: Practice Downward Facing Dog
programme.desc: Dive into the fundamentals of yoga with this sequence that builds up to downward facing dog.
